newsitem.title: POLAND: BA LAUNCHES NEW POLISH ROUTE FROM APRIL 1.
newsitem.headline: BA LAUNCHES NEW POLISH ROUTE FROM APRIL 1.

text.p: British Airways Plc (BA) will launch a direct flight link between London and the city of Krakow in southern Poland from April 1, an airline official said on Friday.
"From April 1 British Airways are launching a permanent connection between Krakow Balice airport and Gatwick," Emilia Osewska, BA Sales Manager Poland, told a news conference.
She said the flights would be on Mondays and Fridays and would be serviced by Boeing 737 (200) mid-range aircraft.
Beginning next month British Airways will also add two new connections between Warsaw and Manchester increasing the number of flights to Poland to 16 per week, she added.
Osewska also said BA would use Krakow's Balice airport as its Polish cargo centre in part because of the involvement of British firms in the construction of General Motors plant in nearby Gliwice.
